channel.title: Vscode on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Vscode on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: vscode: Building Long-Distance Next Edit Suggestions
item.description:
VS Code describes extending GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions so they can propose edits across an entire file rather than only nearby locations.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Your Home for Multi-Agent Development
item.description:
VS Code adds a unified interface to manage multiple coding agents (local, background, and cloud) from one place. It supports using third-party agents like Claude and Codex alongside Copilot and emphasizes interoperability via MCP and Agent Skills.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: January 2026 Insiders (version 1.109)
item.description:
This brief entry announces the Visual Studio Code January 2026 Release (Insiders) version 1.109 and points readers to the full article for details on whatâ€™s new in this release.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Giving Agents a Visual Voice: MCP Apps Support in VS Code
item.description:
Visual Studio Code adds support for MCP Apps so AI agents can present interactive user interfaces inside the editor, enabling richer and more integrated developer workflows.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Building docfind: Fast Client-Side Search with Rust and WebAssembly
item.description:
The article describes building docfind, a high-performance client-side search engine implemented in Rust and compiled to WebAssembly, and highlights how GitHub Copilot sped up development.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: December 2025 (version 1.108)
item.description:
The December 2025 Visual Studio Code release (version 1.108) introduces a set of updates, improvements, and fixes. The full release notes detail editor and tooling enhancements, performance and accessibility work, and changes relevant to extensions and development workflows.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: November 2025 Insiders (version 1.107)
item.description:
This article summarizes whatâ€™s new in the Visual Studio Code November 2025 Release (Insiders build v1.107) and invites readers to read the full release notes for details.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Introducing the VS Code Insiders Podcast
item.description:
Announcement of the VS Code Insiders Podcast â€” a new series serving as an insider’s guide to the features, decisions, and people shaping the future of Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Introducing the Visual Studio Code Private Marketplace: Your Team's Secure, Curated Extension Hub ðŸŽ‰
item.description:
Microsoft announced that the Visual Studio Code Private Marketplace is now generally available â€” a secure, curated extension hub for teams to manage and distribute VS Code extensions privately. Read the full article: https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs/2025/11/18/PrivateMarketplace

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: October 2025 (version 1.106)
item.description:
Announcement page for the Visual Studio Code October 2025 release (version 1.106) pointing readers to the full release notes.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Open Source AI Editor: Second Milestone
item.description:
Ghost text suggestions have been open sourced as part of the Copilot Chat extension â€” the second milestone toward making VS Code an open source AI editor.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: A Unified Experience for all Coding Agents
item.description:
The article announces that coding agents have become central to VS Code in 2025, describing new agent mode, Copilot integration, and the GitHub Copilot CLI while noting the growing ecosystem of agents from providers like OpenAI and Anthropic.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Expanding Model Choice in VS Code with Bring Your Own Key
item.description:
The VS Code blog post introduces the new Language Model Chat Provider API and a Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) experience that lets extensions and users choose and integrate different language models for chat functionality, increasing model choice and extensibility in the editor.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: September 2025 (version 1.105)
item.description:
This is the release announcement for Visual Studio Code September 2025 (version 1.105). It directs readers to the full article for details about whatâ€™s new in this release, including feature updates, improvements, fixes, and extension or API changes.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: Introducing auto model selection (preview)
item.description:
VS Code now offers auto model selection (preview) to automatically choose the best AI model for faster responses, reduced rate limiting, and a 10% discount on premium requests for paid users.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: vscode: August 2025 (version 1.104)
item.description:
Overview of the Visual Studio Code August 2025 release (version 1.104). The article summarizes the release highlights, user-facing improvements, bug fixes, and extension/API updates â€” see the full article for the complete changelog and details.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code
